block.p: * American Petrofina Inc., Dallas, an oil company, said that it had changed its name to Fina, to establish a firmer relationship with its subsidiary Fina Oil and Chemical Co. * Armco Inc., Parsippany, N.J., a steel and field equipment company, said it had signed a letter of intent to purchase Douglas Dynamics, Inc., Milwaukee, a manufacturer of snowplows, from its stockholders for an undisclosed sum. Armco said it hopes to complete the purchase by June.

* American Petrofina Inc., Dallas, an oil company, said that it had changed its name to Fina, to establish a firmer relationship with its subsidiary Fina Oil and Chemical Co. * Armco Inc., Parsippany, N.J., a steel and field equipment company, said it had signed a letter of intent to purchase Douglas Dynamics, Inc., Milwaukee, a manufacturer of snowplows, from its stockholders for an undisclosed sum. Armco said it hopes to complete the purchase by June.

* Collins Foods Inc., Los Angeles, a restaurant operator and franchiser, announced that its stockholders had approved a merger with Sizzler Restaurants International Inc., Los Angeles, a restaurant franchise. Before the merger, Collins Foods owned about 94 percent of outstanding Sizzler stock. * Diamond Shamrock Inc., San Antonio, a petroleum refiner, said it planned to purchase 64 Payless convenience stores in Texas from Strasburger Enterprises, Temple, Tex., a convenience store operator, for an undisclosed sum. * First Wachovia Corp., Winston-Salem, N.C., a holding company, said that it had changed its name to Wachovia Corp. * Guardsman Products Inc., Grand Rapids, Mich., a maker of industrial coatings and packagings, said it had entered into a verbal agreement with an undisclosed company to sell its contract packaging plant in Holland, Mich. * Loral Infared and Imaging Systems, Lexington, Mass., an electro-optical components and systems company, has been awarded a $145 million contract from the Jet Propulsion Laboratory, Pasadena, Calif., to design and build instruments for a program that studies global warming trends. * Wackenhut Corp., Coral Gables, Fla., a security service company, said it had formed a new unit, Waskenhut Monitoring Services Inc., and had plans to enter the electronic monitoring market.
